relation: Short link to the media you have uploaded
Set type of embed code responsive — JS reponsive embed code fixed — iframe embed code with fixed size
Enable secured connection to load media resources yes — Use secure HTTPS connection no — Use HTTP connection
Used to set embed size. Applies only for fixed size embed. Format {w}x{h}. In case one dimension is empty(e.g 160x) they was calculated using 16:9 aspect ratio.
Date starting from which token should be valid, in EST time zone
Date until token should be valid, in EST time zone
Number of seconds from current moment until token expires. Only AllowedToDate or ExpirationTimeSeconds option can be used in one request

IP address mask(s) for which token will be valid. Examples: 192.168.1.50 - just a single IP 192.168.1.1-50 - IP range from 192.168.1.1 to 192.168.1.50 192.168.1.* - IP range from .0 to .255 192.168.1-10.* - even bigger IP range 192.168.2.*,192.168.3.1-50,192.168.4.100 - several masks combined, separated with comma
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {187340=All: WxH, where W and N are any even integers. 3gp: 128x96, 176x144, 352x288, 704x576, 1408x1152 appletv: 710x480 zune: 320x180, 320x240 vp6: WxH, where W and N are multiple of 16}
textBeforeTable: </Query> <!-- ...Action specific contents follows... --> <Notify>[Notify URL]</Notify> <UserKey>[User key]</UserKey> <UserID>[User ID]</UserID> <Action>[Action]</Action> <Query> <?xml version="1.0"?>  All XML requests are expected to be like this: XML Request Anatomy You can try it right away on the API test page: http://m.vid.ly/test/test_api.php. In response Vidly sends XML as well. XML should be placed in xml POST parameter. Vidly accepts XML requests sent on http://m.vid.ly/api/ URL via simple HTTP POST (please note, you should keep trailing slash in URL). API Interface Getting Started Vidly XML API       All in single url. and delivery... Video player, transcoding, device detection,    vid.ly   support features our blog  <a target="_blank" href="//vid.ly/5u4h3e"><img src="//vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster" /></a>
textAfterTable: API Actions Each Action has own set of specific params, each is described in separate section with examples. AddMedia Description Add a new media to user's queue. Creates new short URL and generates 24 various output formats. Also allows to specify user defined custom formats. Along with video formats, several thumbnails generated: URL Description Width × height Snap time http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster Poster image used in video player * × 360 at 10% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster2 Poster image #2 * × 360 at 66% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster3 Poster image #3 * × 360 at 90% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster_hd HD poster image used in video player * × 720 at 10% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster2_hd HD poster image #2 * × 720 at 66% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/poster3_hd HD poster image #3 * × 720 at 90% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/qrposter Poster image, with "Play" button * × 360 at 10% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/thumbnail1 Smaller thumbnail 210 × * at 10% of video length http://vid.ly/5u4h3e/thumbnail2 Smaller thumbnail 210 × *
